image.altText: A police officer inspects plastic bins at Koonwarra tip near Leongatha.

props.synopsis: Prosecutors in the triple-murder trial of Erin Patterson allege traces of death cap mushrooms were found in a food dehydrator Erin Patterson disposed of at a local tip.

title.children: Erin Patterson jury shown footage of accused killer dumping food dehydrator

image.altText: Macquarie sign at top of building.

props.synopsis: Record keeping, complying with regulations and lax reporting standards are issues where Macquarie has fallen short on multiple occasions on a range of issues that date back to at least 2008. A rejuvenated ASIC appears to have run short of patience.

title.children: Why ASIC lost patience with Macquarie's incompetence

image.altText: An external view of Westfield Bondi Junction

props.synopsis: The psychiatrist initially argued on Tuesday that Joel Cuachi's stabbing rampage had "nothing to do with psychosis" during the coronial inquest into the Bondi Junction attack.

title.children: Psychiatrist's evidence branded 'dishonest' after Bondi stabbing flip

image.altText: Rohan Dennis grabs his collar and looks visibly uncomfortable outside court

props.synopsis: Former world champion cyclist Rohan Dennis has been handed a suspended sentence in Adelaide's District Court over the events leading up to the death of his Olympian wife, Melissa Hoskins.

title.children: Rohan Dennis given suspended sentence over death of Olympian wife Melissa Hoskins

image.altText: close up image of ahmed al-sharaa, president of syria

props.synopsis: Syrian President Ahmed al-Sharaa remains a listed terrorist according to the US government, but Donald Trump is determined to restore "normal relations" with the Syrian government.

title.children: Syria's president is still a listed terrorist and Trump just met him. Here's why

image.altText: A man wearing a spacesuit, smiling.

props.synopsis: How working as a guide in the Arctic Circle led Australian adventurer Eric Philips to be invited to take part in an historic space expedition.

title.children: Australian polar adventurer turned astronaut didn't expect space to 'affect me so emotionally'

image.altText: Hannah Ferguson press club AAP

props.synopsis: Political commentator Hannah Ferguson also told the National Press Club of her intention to seek a Senate seat at the next federal election.

title.children: Ferguson concerned by influencers who accept payment from politicians

image.altText: A CCTV still image of a man being attacked in a carpark.

props.synopsis: Locals are concerned over a spate of violent attacks and antisocial behaviour in the inner Perth suburb of Inglewood, with residents calling on the state government to intervene.

title.children: 'We feel scared': Inner-city Perth locals plea for help over safety concerns

image.altText: A woman with her mouth wide open in a parliament ripping a piece of paper.

props.synopsis: In New Zealand, a parliamentary committee has handed down its punishment for the MPs who held a haka on the chamber floor.

title.children: Māori Party MPs suspended over haka protest in NZ parliament

image.altText: A woman with long hair talks to waiting media outside a courtroom.

props.synopsis: Danielle Wilson is suing the Civil Aviation Safety Authority over her husband's death in a remote chopper crash. CASA blames the helicopter operator, which it says "did precisely what CASA said they couldn't".

title.children: Widow of Netflix star 'pleased' with court ruling after fatal helicopter crash

image.altText: Tammy Franks looking sideways from the camera in a pink blazer

props.synopsis: A day after upper house MP Tammy Franks walked out on her party, the South Australian Greens have hit back at their former co-leader – labelling her comments "deeply regrettable and inappropriate".

title.children: ‘Not a good look’: SA Greens respond to Tammy Franks’s shock resignation

image.altText: Household money pic

props.synopsis: Annual wage growth lifted to 3.4 per cent in the March quarter, from 3.2 per cent in December. It is the first annual increase in wage growth since the June quarter last year.

title.children: Annual wage growth ticks up to 3.4 per cent in March quarter

image.altText: Voting centre street signage, unidentified location.

props.synopsis: The AEC says a worker collected a secure container holding 1,866 House of Representatives votes from a Sydney polling booth but failed to deliver it to a central counting centre.

title.children: Almost 2,000 missing ballots found at election worker's home

image.altText: Child overlooking a dam next to green hills.

props.synopsis: In a sharp escalation, New Delhi has suspended its water-sharing treaty with Pakistan and accelerated the construction of four dams — moves that legal experts warn could weaponise water in an already volatile region.

title.children: Why a historic water treaty is a flashpoint between India and Pakistan

image.altText: A man looks at the camera with a blank expression.

props.synopsis: Military figures in Ukraine believe a young Australian was killed in the contested Kharkiv region but his remains have not been located.

title.children: Australian tradie who wanted to 'push himself' in Ukraine feared dead

image.altText: Men walk into war-torn hospital

props.synopsis: Israel has launched air strikes at two hospitals in Gaza, reportedly attempting to assassinate Hamas chief.

title.children: Israel launches deadly strikes on Gaza hospitals, targeting Hamas chief Sinwar

image.altText: A sketch of a greay-bearded man wearing a button-up shirt cupping his face with one hand.

props.synopsis: Peter Sullivan, who spent 38 years, seven months and 21 days in custody, is thought to be the victim of England's longest miscarriage of justice involving a living prisoner.

title.children: Man freed by new DNA evidence after 38 years in prison for murder

image.altText: A woman and a man standing on a stage raise each other's hands

props.synopsis: As the final votes are tallied, here's how the results could shape the future of the Duterte and Marcos clans in the Philippines.

title.children: 'House of Marcos potentially sinking': Fallout from Philippine midterms

image.altText: Hikers bushwalking in the Australian landscape.

props.synopsis: Some NSW national park campgrounds could cost six times more per night if an attempt to standardise fees is adopted, and nature enthusiasts are concerned it will make camping unaffordable for many.

title.children: National parks plan to standardise fees in NSW amid rise in 'ghost camping'

image.altText: Man walking past a glass window.

props.synopsis: A former Queensland mine operator is contesting allegations he failed to comply with a series of environmental requirements before the company he worked for collapsed.

title.children: Chinese investors controlled collapsed mining company's finances, court hears

image.altText: A woman stands with her hands clasped staring at the camera

props.synopsis: MPs were given a conscience vote on the bill brought by Greens MP Amanda Cohn, which will allow nurse-practitioners and endorsed midwives to prescribe abortion medication for early stage pregnancies.

title.children: Bill expanding access to abortion passes NSW lower house

image.altText: A doctor writing a prescription.

props.synopsis: Gun owners in WA are required to have their doctor to sign off on their mental and physical fitness in order to hold a firearms licence, and that has GPs worried.

title.children: Doctors fear for their safety over new gun laws that requires GP mental health check

image.altText: A dark-coloured shopfront with a sign reading "Pane Organico Italian Bakery".

props.synopsis: The director of the popular business pleaded guilty to dozens of offences after health inspectors made numerous stomach-churning discoveries.

title.children: Gold Coast bakery fined $40k after discovery of flies, mould, pigeons

image.altText: rocket in vertical position at night

props.synopsis: A Gold Coast company's orbital rocket could enter space from a north Queensland launch pad by the end of the week. Here's everything you need to know.

title.children: Australia's first home-grown rocket counts down to cow paddock launch

image.altText: An Air Canada plane parked on the tarmac, taken on an unspecified date.

props.synopsis: The 2019 Vancouver to Sydney flight experienced significant turbulence at 36,000 feet. It landed in Honlulu, Hawaii, with 37 injuries recorded, nine of which were major.

title.children: Passengers who claimed injuries from turbulence lose High Court appeal

image.altText: An Aboriginal woman wearing a red blazer and black top, delivering a speech in parliament.

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory opposition leader has delivered her first budget reply speech, claiming the jurisdiction's future will be "bleak" under the government's prison-focused crime approach.

title.children: Opposition calls NT budget 'bleak' with 'delusional' solutions to crime

image.altText: A sign that says "Back Beach" near a shrub-lined trail to a beach.

props.synopsis: A local fisher is calling for more to be done to warn people of the danger at a Streaky Bay beach where two women drowned this week.

title.children: Double drowning leaves SA community reeling

image.altText: lyle and erik menedez sit in a beverly hills courtroom in 1990 wearing black suits

props.synopsis: Erik and Lyle Menendez will have a new shot at freedom after a judge reduced the brothers' sentences from life without parole to 50 years to life.

title.children: Judge reduces Menendez brothers' murder sentences, now eligible for parole

image.altText: A woman with a social media award smiling for the camera

props.synopsis: Dr Kristyn Sommer says it didn't feel right to post about her children anymore despite having more than half a million followers on TikTok and Instagram.

title.children: Kristyn's travel video with her kids had 18 million views. She chose to delete it

image.altText: Three people try to rescue a wet kangaroo using a ladder.

props.synopsis: Animal rescuers want a kangaroo-proof fence installed along a 70km open water channel in central Victoria to stop wildlife from drowning.

title.children: Rescuers clean up mess of dead wildlife amid health concerns

image.altText: A brunette woman hugs her elderly mother.

props.synopsis: The ACT government will support Burrangiri Aged Care Respite Centre to stay open for another two years.

title.children: 'I was disgusted': Residents applaud delay of respite service closure

image.altText: Girl looking sad at playground

props.synopsis: The national children's commissioner wants a cabinet minister for children and is calling on governments to "act on evidence" from child protection reports. This comes after the ABC exposed that children were being sexually exploited in the $2 billion residential care system.

title.children: 'Shameful': Demand for action after residential care exploitation revelations

image.altText: Sam Kerr of Australia greets fans, smiling and engaging

props.synopsis: Injured Matildas captain Sam Kerr remains a "camp by camp" proposition and may decide to complete full pre-season with Chelsea before returning to the international scene.

title.children: Matildas squad named, no certainty on Sam Kerr's return

image.altText: A possum clings to a tree at night.

props.synopsis: Despite being one of the most abundant, widespread and frequently encountered Australian marsupials, little is known about the distribution of common brushtail possums in the north-west of the country.

title.children: Scientists surprised to discover possums in the Pilbara
